summary: Jacqueline Hess was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates. The consistency of her appearance in these payroll documents indicates her involvement as a staff member during the committee's operations.
significance: Jacqueline Hess's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation, though the specific nature and extent of her role are not detailed in the provided documents.
